content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: $EXVAMT_EXISTS
      operator: equal_to
      value: true
    - name: EC
      operator: exists
Operations:
  - domain: EX
    id: $EXVAMT_EXISTS
    name: EXVAMT
    operator: variable_exists
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SDTMIG.CG0105
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: When EC exists, EXVAMT should not be used.
Outcome:
  Message: EXVAMT is present when EC exists.
  Output Variables:
    - EXVAMT
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Dataset
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0105
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: '"When the EC domain is implemented in conjunction
                  with the EX domain, EXVAMT and EXVAMTU should not be used in EX;  collected
                  values instead would be represented in ECDOSE and ECDOSU."'
                Document: IG v3.4
                Item: Assumption 6c
                Section: 6.1.3.1
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - INTERVENTIONS
  Domains:
    Include:
      - EX

json.Description: When EC exists, EXVAMT should not be used.

Outcome.Message: EXVAMT is present when EC exists.

Citations.Cited_Guidance: "When the EC domain is implemented in conjunction with the EX domain, EXVAMT and EXVAMTU should not be used in EX;  collected values instead would be represented in ECDOSE and ECDOSU."
